title: Gyeongsan
text:
Gyeongsan () is a <a href="Administrative%20divisions%20of%20South%20Korea">city</a> in <a href="North%20Gyeongsang">North Gyeongsang</a> Province, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>. Its western border abuts the metropolitan city of <a href="Daegu">Daegu</a>, and much of Gyeongsan lies within the Daegu <a href="metropolitan%20area">metropolitan area</a>.
Numerous <a href="university">universities</a> are located in Gyeongsan, such as <a href="Yeungnam%20University">Yeungnam University</a>, <a href="Daegu%20University">Daegu University</a>, <a href="Daekyeung%20University">Daekyeung University</a>, <a href="Catholic%20University%20of%20Daegu">Catholic University of Daegu</a> and <a href="Gyeongil%20University">Gyeongil University</a>.
Symbols of City.
The city flower is the <a href="magnolia">magnolia</a> which grows well even in poor soil conditions. The city bird is the <a href="magpie">magpie</a>. Its clear song reflects the bright and hopeful spirits of citizens. The city tree is the <a href="Ginkgo%20biloba">ginkgo</a>. It symbolizes the constant prosperity, perseverance and elegant traits of Gyeongsan citizens.
International Chemistry Olympiad.
Gyeongsan was the host for the 38th <a href="International%20Chemistry%20Olympiad">International Chemistry Olympiad</a> (2 July 2006 - 11 July 2006).
Twin towns – sister cities.
Gyeongsan is <a href="Sister%20city">twinned</a> with:
Administrative districts.
Gyeongsan is divided into 3 eup, 5 myeon and 7 dong. Amnyang was promoted to eup status on 1 January 2020.
Location.
Gyeongsan city lies mid-western part of <a href="Gyeongsangbuk-do">Gyeongsangbuk-do</a>. It is close to several big cities such as <a href="Daegu">Daegu</a>, <a href="Ulsan">Ulsan</a>, <a href="Busan">Busan</a> and many other places.
Climate.
The climate is mild because of its southern location. However, being landlocked makes its climate continental.
The amount of rainfall is less than the average yearly rainfall of Korea, due to its geographical characteristics.
External links.
